Karl Wright wrote:
> Folks,
> I need to set up Heritrix to run under Apache, such that Apache is
> forwarding requests to Heritrix, and the Heritrix UI cannot be accessed
> directly from off-box EXCEPT through apache.
>
> Tomcat has a feature that allows you to specify that it will not accept
> direct connections from anywhere other than localhost.  I'd like to set
> up the same thing with Heritrix.  Would anyone know how to do this?

You could use WAR version of Heritrix and host it in tomcat.

Or it looks like you could make Heritrix UI go via AJP (mod_jk or 
mod_jk2) by changing the Listener installed into Jetty.  Currently we 
use SocketListener.  You could try changing 
http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/SimpleHttpServer.html#173 
so that instead we use 
http://jetty.mortbay.org/javadoc/org/mortbay/http/ajp/AJP13Listener.html 
(See also http://www.mortbay.com/jetty/faq?s=700-Clustering&t=modjk.  
You'll need to translate the jetty xml config. to API calls).  I haven't 
tried it.

Or try using the SocketListener constructor that takes host and port or 
inetaddress and set the address to be localhost: See 
http://jetty.mortbay.org/javadoc/org/mortbay/http/SocketListener.html 
and the above cited location in Heritrix code where we initialize the 
webserver.

St.Ack
